title: TVLine Items: Hawaii Five-0 Vet Joins Silicon Valley Series, Love Is Blind Reunion Date and More
description: Meaghan Rath has found a techy new role. The Hawaii Five-0 vet has joined AMC and AMC+’s untitled Silicon Valley series, starring Billy Magnussen (Made for Love) and Sarah Goldberg (Barry), our sister site Deadline reports. The forthcoming show — from writer and showrunner Jonathan Glatzer (Succession, Bad Sisters, Better Call Saul) — is set inside the bubble […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: 'Hawaii Five-0' vet Meaghan Rath joins AMC and AMC+'s untitled Silicon Valley series, starring Billy Magnussen and Sarah Goldberg — get more details!
text: TVLine Items: Hawaii Five-0 Vet Joins Silicon Valley Series, Love Is Blind Reunion Date and MoreMeaghan Rath has found a techy new role. The Hawaii Five-0 vet has joined AMC and AMC+’s untitled Silicon Valley series, starring Billy Magnussen (Made for Love) and Sarah Goldberg (Barry), our sister site Deadline reports. The forthcoming show — from writer and showrunner Jonathan Glatzer (Succession, Bad Sisters, Better Call Saul) — is set inside the bubble of Silicon Valley, “amid misguided corporate cultures, moony innovation labs and cutthroat private high schools,” the official synopsis reads. “In our story, a scandal is sparked by the exploitation of personal data which unravels out of a rift between a self-appointed ‘inventor of the future’ tech CEO (played by Magnussen) and his self-serving ‘performance psychologist’ (Goldberg).” Rath — whose credits also include Children Ruin Everything and Being Human — will play the Chief Ethicist at a Cupertino-based tech company and the former mistress of Magnussen’s character. Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * The Love Is Blind Season 8 reunion will stream Sunday, March 9 at 9 pm ET/6 pm PT on Netflix.  * The 2025 American Music Awards will air live Monday, May 26 on CBS (and streaming on Paramount+) from Las Vegas, marking the first time the ceremony has been broadcast on TV since 2022. * Ethan Slater (Wicked) will guest-star in Elsbeth’s April 10 episode as a chatty new police officer at the precinct, People reports. * An Oprah Winfrey Special: The Menopause Revolution will air Monday, March 31 at 10 pm on ABC. Special guests include Halle Berry, Naomi Watts and Maria Shriver, as well as medical experts. * Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain, in which the actress goes “on a gastronomic pilgrimage across the land of her ancestors as she indulges in the rich tapestry of Spanish cuisine,” will premiere Sunday, April 27 at 9 pm on CNN. Watch a trailer: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
TVLine Items: Hawaii Five-0 Vet Joins Silicon Valley Series, Love Is Blind Reunion Date and More

Meaghan Rath has found a techy new role.

The Hawaii Five-0 vet has joined AMC and AMC+’s untitled Silicon Valley series, starring Billy Magnussen (Made for Love) and Sarah Goldberg (Barry), our sister site Deadline reports.

The forthcoming show — from writer and showrunner Jonathan Glatzer (Succession, Bad Sisters, Better Call Saul) — is set inside the bubble of Silicon Valley, “amid misguided corporate cultures, moony innovation labs and cutthroat private high schools,” the official synopsis reads. “In our story, a scandal is sparked by the exploitation of personal data which unravels out of a rift between a self-appointed ‘inventor of the future’ tech CEO (played by Magnussen) and his self-serving ‘performance psychologist’ (Goldberg).”

Rath — whose credits also include Children Ruin Everything and Being Human — will play the Chief Ethicist at a Cupertino-based tech company and the former mistress of Magnussen’s character.

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* The Love Is Blind Season 8 reunion will stream Sunday, March 9 at 9 pm ET/6 pm PT on Netflix. 

* The 2025 American Music Awards will air live Monday, May 26 on CBS (and streaming on Paramount+) from Las Vegas, marking the first time the ceremony has been broadcast on TV since 2022.

* Ethan Slater (Wicked) will guest-star in Elsbeth’s April 10 episode as a chatty new police officer at the precinct, People reports.

* An Oprah Winfrey Special: The Menopause Revolution will air Monday, March 31 at 10 pm on ABC. Special guests include Halle Berry, Naomi Watts and Maria Shriver, as well as medical experts.

* Eva Longoria: Searching for Spain, in which the actress goes “on a gastronomic pilgrimage across the land of her ancestors as she indulges in the rich tapestry of Spanish cuisine,” will premiere Sunday, April 27 at 9 pm on CNN. Watch a trailer:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
